questions.text: Meta Objects in STIX are generally used to
options: Provide information about STIX objects, such as labels or markings.
Represent tangible cyber entities like IP addresses or files.
Store complex data structures that can't be defined by other objects.
Describe the physical hardware of a compromised system.
questions.correctAnswer: Provide information about STIX objects, such as labels or markings.

questions.text: An Intrusion Set SDO differs from a Campaign SDO in that it
options: Focuses on the technical details of a specific malware instance.
Captures multiple campaigns with shared attributes over a long period.
Represents a specific incident or wave of attacks.
Describes the geographic origin of a cyberattack.
questions.correctAnswer: Captures multiple campaigns with shared attributes over a long period.

questions.text: How does the Sighting Object differ from other relationship objects in STIX?
options: It is used solely to indicate communication between different systems.
It always involves at least three entities: an actor, a target, and a tool.
It only links attack techniques to specific vulnerabilities.
It doesn't represent a relationship but provides metadata about an object.
questions.correctAnswer: It doesn't represent a relationship but provides metadata about an object.

questions.text: How does the introduction of Meta Objects in STIX 2.1 enhance the representation of threat intelligence?
options: By allowing for more detailed metadata, improving the accuracy of data analysis.
By integrating all metadata directly into the core STIX Objects, simplifying data structures.
By enabling the separation of core threat data from contextual and descriptive metadata, enhancing data organization
By reducing the overall complexity of the STIX framework, making it more user-friendly.
questions.correctAnswer: By enabling the separation of core threat data from contextual and descriptive metadata, enhancing data organization

questions.text: In what way does the Bundle Object facilitate the sharing of threat intelligence?
options: By ensuring that all objects within the bundle are related to the same incident.
By compressing the data within the bundle, reducing transmission time.
By automatically validating the objects within the bundle, ensuring data accuracy.
By providing a container for STIX Objects, making it easier to transmit complex sets of related data in a single package
questions.correctAnswer: By providing a container for STIX Objects, making it easier to transmit complex sets of related data in a single package

questions.text: What is the Malware SDO primarily used for?
options: To document the financial impact of malware on an organization.
To identify the geographic location of malware origin.
To provide intelligence on a specific instance or family of malware.
To describe legal actions taken against malware creators.
questions.correctAnswer: To provide intelligence on a specific instance or family of malware.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the Data Marking Object in STIX 2.1 is true?
options: It is used to categorize threat intelligence data by severity.
It tracks the provenance and ownership of the threat intelligence data.
It automatically encrypts sensitive data within a STIX Bundle.
It applies labels to data objects to indicate handling and sharing restrictions.
questions.correctAnswer: It applies labels to data objects to indicate handling and sharing restrictions.

questions.text: In the context of STIX, what is the primary function of the Attack Pattern SDO?
options: To represent the location of a cyberattack.
To categorize and describe the tactics used by threat actors.
To document the financial impact of a cyberattack.
To record the identities of the attackers involved.
questions.correctAnswer: To categorize and describe the tactics used by threat actors.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of Machine Readable Threat Intelligence (MRTI)?
options: To manually analyze threat actor patterns.
To develop software for cyberattack simulations.
To create human-readable reports for cybersecurity experts.
To automate the exchange of threat intelligence data.
questions.correctAnswer: To automate the exchange of threat intelligence data.

questions.text: What is a key difference between a Grouping SDO and a STIX Bundle?
options: A Grouping object asserts shared context, while a STIX Bundle does not.
A Grouping object is used for malware analysis, while a STIX Bundle is not.
A Grouping object conveys no context, while a STIX Bundle explicitly asserts context.
A Grouping object is used for reporting incidents, while a STIX Bundle is not.
questions.correctAnswer: A Grouping object asserts shared context, while a STIX Bundle does not.
